page.title: 04THE BUILDERS YARD
page.content:
In the centre of the Parish of Cairnie is a builders yard. The owner used to employ 7 or 8 men but now works on his own. Most of his work is done locally not extending beyond Huntly and Keith.
He makes bungalows and farm buildings. He also does house extensions but most of his work is concerned with the general maintenance and repair of existing buildings.
In the yard he makes concrete blocks and artificial granite blocks; concrete lintels and window-sills. All other work is done on the site. Although he does use some locally grown timber, most of the timber he uses is imported red or white pine.
